message: THE ROOM
OH. MY. GOD.
You are NOT gonna believe what just happened.
Microsoft just dropped my cousin like a BAD HABIT.
Shanaya. The one who’s been flexing her LinkedIn grind since 2019. The one who was 'making the big bucks.' GONE.
No warning. No severance. Just *bye-bye*, don’t let the Outlook login hit you on the way out.
I swear to god, this woman has been my personal villain since DAY ONE.
First, she stole my favorite blue crayon in second grade.
Then she became the family genius who 'actually had a plan in life.'
Then she started making passive-aggressive digs about how I should try 'corporate stability' instead of, you know, 'chasing scandals'—
*And now,* Miss Big Tech Girlie has been yeeted out of Microsoft with a ‘your performance sucked, sorry lol’ email.
Kunal.
What kind of unhinged morning energy is this?
And why am I the person you're choosing to share it with?
Because I KNOW you’re the only one who will appreciate the irony of all this.
*Appreciate* is a strong word.
also we're not close enough for this.
okay
Why is Kunal using caps lock like he’s about to declare war on someone?
RUHI. YOU'RE HERE. OKAY, LISTEN—
Oh god, what.
Microsoft just booted Shanaya out. No severance. Immediate termination. Cold-blooded corporate execution.
Wait, your cousin? The oooh journalism wasn’t a 'real job' one?
THE VERY ONE.
Oh wow. I should feel bad but... I don't.
Is this bad karma or just poetic justice?
*EXACTLY* my point.
you two realize you are absolutely diabolical, right?
Mr. Gupta is gonna *love* playing therapist for this mess.
oh shush
okay but wait, this is actually awful, right?
They just fired her? No warning? No payout?
None. She got an email saying her performance didn't 'meet minimum expectations' and POOF. Gone.
That’s actually insane.
Like okay, I was ready to laugh at her downfall but now I kinda wanna fight someone at Microsoft.
Right?? It’s actually brutal. No security, no stability, just vibes and capitalism.
Okay, now I'm confused. Are we happy or mad about this?
We’re mad that corporations can do this.
And also *a little* happy that Shanaya’s LinkedIn flex era is over. ugh 'I am *so so thrilled to share*' ew
ugh okay I don't have time for this.
did you guys see what is happening in Delhi by the way?
getting a little worried
Did you just say 'cap-ih-tal-ism' like that?
What.
You stressed the wrong syllable. It’s *cap-i-tal-ism*, not 'cap-ih-tal-ism.' You sound like a malfunctioning robot.
Harshit I BEG you to enter a conversation normally just ONCE.
And just stop, Kunal. Let me put this in terms even *you* won’t twist.
oh come on
explain what?
It’s DeepSeek AI. The Chinese company that’s making OpenAI look like a high school project.
And this connects to my cousin losing her job... how?
well because-

Because Microsoft is having an existential crisis. They bet big on OpenAI, and now, suddenly, OpenAI isn’t the golden goose anymore. DeepSeek is offering **better AI at lower prices**. If OpenAI fails, Microsoft fails. When companies panic, they **cut dead weight**—like your cousin.
I WAS TALKING.
...bro, you could've just said 'layoffs happened.'
Yeah, and you could've used Google instead of whining in my direction. But here we are.
HELLO?
But. Yeah, fair. Ugh she *is* dead weight.
plus DeepSeek doesn’t have a bunch of lawsuits breathing down its neck. They move fast. No one in the West can keep up.
on top of that Grok is actually releasing tonight at 8. No one knows where that will stand.
ugh I am just gonna let Mr. Gupta talk to you guys
so you like him now?
NOW YOU HEAR ME?
well eh
but yeah seriously, OpenAI is just... dying?
Not yet. But the panic is real. Microsoft poured billions into OpenAI, expecting them to **dominate**.
Now they’re realizing they might’ve backed the wrong horse.
So basically, some tech bros in a boardroom saw a graph go down and decided to ruin people’s lives?
Welcome to capitalism, Kunal. You think decisions are made with **ethics**? They’re made with **spreadsheets**. Your cousin was a number that didn’t add up anymore.
cap-ih-tal-ism, cap-i-tal-ism
Wow. Happy? Saying that made you feel tough?
Well it's reality. People who understand it get ahead. People who don’t... well, they get laid off and complain about it on LinkedIn.
Damn. So empathy just *missed* you completely?
is there really a difference?
Oh, I have empathy. I just don’t waste it on things I can’t change.
You say that, but you just ranted at us for ten minutes like an evil TED Talk.
And yet, you listened. Because deep down
You know I’m right.
People who complain get left behind. People who **learn the system** survive. And people who **control the system**? They win. That's just the rule.
Okay where is my chair.
God, you talk like a villain monologuing before the final boss fight.
That’s because I actually **know what I’m talking about**. And the rest of you? You just react.
if you’re so smart, why can't you sit on that chair?
I am gonna ask again, where is **my** chair?
There are lots of chairs over there?
That's not the point. Where is *my* chair?
Just sit anywhere Harshit
They are not *my chairs*. I want my chair.
It had a little limp in it, and was so old it basically curved around me.
just give it back, are you kids
seriously? Of all things, you decided to get attached to a chair?
You’re all insufferable.
I need to take this call. Be right back.
this is so unacceptable I swear to god=
have my chair
IT IS NOT MY-
Who are you?
I'm Mr. Verma, the new mediator.
New mediator? What happened to Mr. Gupta?
Mr. Gupta is no longer with us. Personal reasons, I believe. But I assure you, the purpose of these sessions remains the same.
Which is...? To bore us to death with pointless discussions?
Also, the apartment committee has expressed… a certain dissatisfaction with recent events. Hence the change
is this finally ending then?
We want the same thing Ruhi, that is the correct name right?
yes but I still don't get what you mean
despite numerous inquiries, no clear… narrative has emerged. No single culprit. No conclusive evidence.
Which brings us to these sessions. The committee's frustration is… understandable.  They're seeking *resolution*.
Resolution?  How is *this* supposed to provide resolution? We're just sitting here
These sessions are designed to… encourage reflection. To foster a sense of shared responsibility. To—
To appease the committee?  Because they couldn't figure out who to blame, so they're blaming all of us?
Well the committee believes that through structured discussion, a clearer picture might emerge. Perhaps someone will remember something. Perhaps… a new perspective will arise.
Or perhaps we'll just waste another six months of our lives talking in circles.
That, Mr. Kunal, is entirely up to you. The committee has given you an opportunity. An opportunity to demonstrate…civic responsibility.  Or, shall we say, an opportunity to avoid further… escalation.
Escalation? What kind of escalation?
Let's talk about that fire alarm
